com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.filter.account

Class ImmutableAccount

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.filter.account.ImmutableAccount
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Account, Auditable, Deletable, Extendable, Resource, Saveable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HttpImmutableAccount

    public class ImmutableAccount
extends Object
implements Account
    Internal implementation class, not to be used by SDK users.
    Since:
    1.0.RC3

      • getUsername

        public String getUsername()
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Returns the account's username, guaranteed to be unique for all accounts within a Directory. If you do not have need of a username, it is best to set the username to equal the Account.getEmail().
        Specified by:
        getUsername in interface Account
        Returns:
        the account's username, guaranteed to be unique for all accounts within a Directory.

      • setUsername

        public Account setUsername(String username)
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Sets the account's username, which must be unique among all other accounts within a Directory. If you do not have need of a username, it is best to set the username to equal the Account.getEmail().

        An attempt to set a username that is in use when creating or saving the account will result in a Error

        Specified by:
        setUsername in interface Account
        Parameters:
        username - the account's username, which must be unique among all other accounts within a Directory.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • setPassword

        public Account setPassword(String password)
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Sets (changes) the account's password to the specified raw (plaintext) password. ONLY call this method if you legitimately want to set the account password directly. It is usually more advisable to use Stormpath's account password reset email workflow (when possible).

        After calling this method, you must call Saveable.save() to propagate the change to the Stormpath servers.

        Specified by:
        setPassword in interface Account
        Parameters:
        password - the account's new raw (plaintext) password.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getFullName

        public String getFullName()
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Returns the account's 'full name', per Western cultural conventions.

        This is NOT a persistent/settable/queryable property. It is a convenience computed property combining the givenName (aka 'first name' in Western cultures) followed by the middleName (if any) followed by the surname (aka 'last name' in Western cultures).

        Specified by:
        getFullName in interface Account
        Returns:
        the account's 'full name', per Western cultural conventions.

      • getGroups

        public GroupList getGroups()
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Returns a paginated list of the account's assigned groups.

        Tip: If this list might be large, instead of iterating over all groups, it might be more convenient (and practical) to execute a search for one or more of the account's groups using the Account.getGroups(com.stormpath.sdk.group.GroupCriteria) or Account.getGroups(java.util.Map) methods instead of this one.

        Specified by:
        getGroups in interface Account
        Returns:
        a paginated list of all groups assigned to the Account.
        See Also:
        Account.getGroups(com.stormpath.sdk.group.GroupCriteria), Account.getGroups(java.util.Map)

      • getGroups

        public GroupList getGroups(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Returns a paginated list of the account's assigned groups that match the specified query criteria.

        This method is mostly provided as a non-type-safe alternative to the Account.getGroups(com.stormpath.sdk.group.GroupCriteria) method which might be useful in dynamic languages on the JVM (for example, with Groovy): 

         def groups = account.getGroups([description: '*foo*', orderBy: 'name desc', limit: 50])
        The query parameter names and values must be equal to those documented in the Stormpath REST API product guide.

        Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String name to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

         .../accounts/accountId/groups?param1=value1¶m2=value2&...

        If in doubt, use Account.getGroups(com.stormpath.sdk.group.GroupCriteria) as all possible query options are available via type-safe guarantees that can be auto-completed by most IDEs.
        Specified by:
        getGroups in interface Account
        Parameters:
        queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the account's groups that match the specified query criteria.

      • getGroups

        public GroupList getGroups(GroupCriteria criteria)
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Returns a paginated list of the account's assigned groups that match the specified query criteria. The Groups utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL - most modern IDEs can auto-suggest and auto-complete as you type, allowing for an easy query-building experience. For example: 
         account.getGroups(Groups.where(
     Groups.description().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(Groups.name().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderByName()
     .orderByStatus().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        or, if you use static imports: 
         import static com.stormpath.sdk.group.Groups.*;

 ...

 account.getGroups(where(
      description().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(name().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderByName()
     .orderByStatus().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        Specified by:
        getGroups in interface Account
        Parameters:
        criteria - the criteria to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the account's groups that match the specified query criteria.

      • addGroup

        public GroupMembership addGroup(Group group)
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Assigns this account to the specified Group.

        Immediate Execution: Unlike other Account methods, you do not need to call Saveable.save() afterwards. This method will interact with the server immediately.

        Specified by:
        addGroup in interface Account
        Parameters:
        group - the Group this account will be added to
        Returns:
        the new GroupMembership resource created reflecting the account-to-group association.

      • addGroup

        public GroupMembership addGroup(String hrefOrName)
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Assigns this account to the specified Group represented by its (case insensitive) name or href

        Immediate Execution: Unlike other Account methods, you do not need to call Saveable.save() afterwards. This method will persist the changes in the backend immediately.

        Specified by:
        addGroup in interface Account
        Parameters:
        hrefOrName - the href or name of the group to add.
        Returns:
        the new GroupMembership resource created reflecting the account-to-group association.

        Description copied from interface: Account

      • getApiKeys

        public ApiKeyList getApiKeys()
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Returns all ApiKeys that belong to this account. The account can use any of these ApiKeys (that are enabled) to communicate with your Application's API (e.g. REST API). See application.authenticateApiRequest(request) and application.authenticateOauthRequest(request) for more information.
        Specified by:
        getApiKeys in interface Account
        Returns:
        all ApiKeys that belong to this account.

      • getApiKeys

        public ApiKeyList getApiKeys(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Returns a paginated list of the account's api keys that match the specified query criteria. The account can use any of these ApiKeys (that are enabled) to communicate with your Application's API (e.g. REST API). See application.authenticateApiRequest(request) and application.authenticateOauthRequest(request) for more information.

        This method is mostly provided as a non-type-safe alternative to the Account.getApiKeys(com.stormpath.sdk.api.ApiKeyCriteria) method which might be useful in dynamic languages on the JVM (for example, with Groovy): 

         def apiKeys = account.getApiKeys([expand: 'tenant'])
        The query parameter names and values must be equal to those documented in the Stormpath REST API product guide.

        Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String name to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

         .../accounts/accountId/apiKeys?param1=value1¶m2=value2&...

        If in doubt, use Account.getApiKeys(com.stormpath.sdk.api.ApiKeyCriteria) as all possible query options are available via type-safe guarantees that can be auto-completed by most IDEs.
        Specified by:
        getApiKeys in interface Account
        Parameters:
        queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the account's api keys that match the specified query criteria.

      • getApiKeys

        public ApiKeyList getApiKeys(ApiKeyCriteria criteria)
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Returns a paginated list of the account's api keys that match the specified query criteria. The ApiKeys utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL - most modern IDEs can auto-suggest and auto-complete as you type, allowing for an easy query-building experience. For example: 
         account.getApiKeys(ApiKeys.criteria().offsetBy(50).withTenant());
        or, if you use static imports: 
         import static com.stormpath.sdk.api.ApiKeys.*;

 ...

 account.getApiKeys(criteria().offsetBy(50).withTenant());
        Specified by:
        getApiKeys in interface Account
        Parameters:
        criteria - the criteria to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the account's api keys that match the specified query criteria.

      • createApiKey

        public ApiKey createApiKey()
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Creates a new ApiKey assigned to this account in the Stormpath server and returns the created resource. The account can then use the ApiKey to communicate with your Application's API (e.g. REST API). See application.authenticateApiRequest(request) and application.authenticateOauthRequest(request) for more information.

        Security Notice

        The returned ApiKey's secret is considered extremely sensitive. Stormpath strongly recommends that you make newly generated ApiKeys accessible to your accounts via a File download that stays secure on their file system.

        Specified by:
        createApiKey in interface Account
        Returns:
        the newly created ApiKey.

      • createApiKey

        public ApiKey createApiKey(ApiKeyOptions options)
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Creates a new ApiKey assigned to this account in the Stormpath server and ensures the returned ApiKey reflects the specified ApiKeyOptions. The account can then use the ApiKey to communicate with your Application's API (e.g. REST API). See application.authenticateApiRequest(request) and application.authenticateOauthRequest(request) for more information.

        Security Notice

        The returned ApiKey's secret is considered extremely sensitive. Stormpath strongly recommends that you make newly generated ApiKeys accessible to your accounts via a File download that stays secure on their file system.

        Specified by:
        createApiKey in interface Account
        Parameters:
        options - The ApiKeyOptions to use to customize the ApiKey resource returned in the create response.

      • getApplications

        public ApplicationList getApplications()
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Returns a paginated list of the applications that the account may login to. You may control which accounts may log in to specific applications by managing an application's mapped AccountStores.

        Tip: Instead of iterating over all applications, it might be more convenient (and practical) to execute a search for one or more applications using the Account.getApplications(ApplicationCriteria) method instead of this one.

        Specified by:
        getApplications in interface Account
        Returns:
        a paginated list of all of the Account's Application resources.
        See Also:
        Account.getApplications(com.stormpath.sdk.application.ApplicationCriteria), Account.getApplications(java.util.Map), Application.getAccountStoreMappings(), Application.addAccountStore(com.stormpath.sdk.directory.AccountStore)

      • getApplications

        public ApplicationList getApplications(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Returns a paginated list of the applications that the account may login to that match the specified query criteria. You may control which accounts may log in to specific applications by managing an application's mapped AccountStores.

        Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String name to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

         .../accounts/accountId/applications?param1=value1&param2=value2&...
        Specified by:
        getApplications in interface Account
        Parameters:
        queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Account's applications that match the specified query criteria.
        See Also:
        Application.getAccountStoreMappings(), Application.addAccountStore(com.stormpath.sdk.directory.AccountStore)

      • getApplications

        public ApplicationList getApplications(ApplicationCriteria criteria)
        Description copied from interface: Account
        Returns a paginated list of the applications that the account may login to that match the specified query criteria. The Applications utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL. For example: 
         account.getApplications(Applications
     .where(Applications.description().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(Applications.name().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderByName().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        Specified by:
        getApplications in interface Account
        Parameters:
        criteria - the the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Account's applications that match the specified query criteria.
        See Also:
        Application.getAccountStoreMappings(), Application.addAccountStore(com.stormpath.sdk.directory.AccountStore)
